name: Floodplain complexity
functionStatement: Frequent overbank flows reduce flood peaks, support riparian vegetation, create off-channel refugia, and extend nutrient processing time.
descriptionMarkdown: Floodplain/off-channel features stay diverse/connected at moderate floods, reflecting minimal loss.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Delineate side channels, oxbows, and wetlands and assess connectivity during moderate floods using field checks and available mapping.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Both banks are leveed or the reach is straightened and dredged. No off-channel areas remain despite historical evidence.
Criteria: Drastically simplified or leveed. No functional off-channel areas.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Only a small backwater remains. Most historic features are isolated or filled.
Criteria: Most side channels lost or isolated. Minimal diversity of floodplain features.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Some side channels remain but several are truncated by berms or levees. Connectivity occurs only in parts of the reach.
Criteria: Partial complexity. Some features are disconnected at moderate floods.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Multiple active side channels, backwaters, and oxbows exchange flow during moderate floods. Field photos confirm inundation paths.
Criteria: Several off-channel features connected at ~1-2 year stage; pattern resembles historical complexity.
